availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Elisha Green (Union County, Tennessee, farmer and sgt 11th TN Cav (U.S.A.))

body.p: Union County, Tennessee, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Robert Green and Ann Green. Married to Mary Green. Father of Sarah A. Green and Rhoda J. Green. Farmer in Lee County, Virginia, in 1850. Farmer in Union County, Tennessee, in 1860. Served in the 11th Tennessee Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as sergeant. Captured in Lee County, Virginia, on February 22, 1864. Paroled at City Point, Virginia, on March 21, 1864. Died of typhoid fever while in service in Annapolis, Maryland, on April 8, 1864.

ab.bibl:
